712281f-a.text:
(1)
East 36th Street, west from First Ave., and showing St. Gabriel's Park. Over towering everything is the Empire State Building.
April 8, 1936.
P.L. Sperr
(2)
The same, from another angle.
October 12, 1936.
P.L. Sperr

707583f-a.text:
First Avenue, west side, south from E. 36th Street, showing St Gabriel's Park extending between same and 35th Street. Buildings appearing across same are on the south side of E. 35th Street, west of the Avenue. To the right is the rear of the 12 story Harriet Hubbard Ayer Building, No 317-23 E. 34th Street (q.v.). See
same for general views of this area.
January 7, 1939
Sorrach Photo Service
New York City Tunnel Nuthority

707544f-a.text:
First Avenue, east side, north from E. 36th to 37th Streets. At the left margin appears a portion of the former Kips Bay Brewery, extending north of 37th Street.
January 8, 1939
Somach Photo Service
New York City Tunnel Authority

707581f-a.text:
First Avenue, east side, south from E. 36th Street.
January 8, 1939
Somach Photo Service
New York City Tunnel Authority

707587f-a.text:
First Avenue, east side, south from E. 37th te 36th
Streets.
January 31, 1939
Samach Photo Service
New York City Tunnel Autherity

707588f.text:
First Avenue, west side, from E. 30th (left) to 37th Streets, showing the Midtown Queens Tunnel clearance extending to Second Avenue ("El" thereupon). In solitary dignity stands the St. Gabriel's branch of the New York Public Library. This is shortly to come down. Note St. Gabriel's Park at the left and the Empire State Building in the background.
Sept 20, 1939
Nathan Schwartz
New York Public Library

712275f-a.text:
East 36th Street, west of First Avenue, as photographed across the avenue and St. Gabriel's Park. This entire block is to be cleared for the Midtown-Queens Tunnel approach. Note on the right a part of this activity already under way. St. Gabriel's Church and Parochial School were included. Forming a backdrop are the skyscrapers oonstituting the Grand Central-42nd Street outline. From left to right respectively, these are, the Chanin, R. C. A., Chrysler, News, Waldorf-Astoria and General Electric Buildings. The Tudor City Hotel Woodstock is on the right.
1939
Alexander Alland
This photo is one of a series that appeared in the published volume "Portrait of N.Y." by Felix Reisenberg and Alex. Alland, IRGV.

712276f-a.text:
E. 36th Street, west from First Avenue, showing prominently the northeasterly corner of St. Gabriel's Park, viewed southwestward. Bounding this open area are buildings on 35th Street (left), Second Avenue (center, "El" thereupon) and 36th Street (ri.ht(. In the background, at Fifth Avenue and 34th Street, is the huge
Empire State Building.
January 8, 1939
Somach Photo Service
New York City Tunnel Authority

712277f-b.text:
East 36th Street, west from First avenue, showing the cleared area extending 1 block souare and which will provide an extance to the new l.idtown - Gueens Tunnel. Standing alone is the New York Public Library Branch. This will come down in early 1940. The tenements at the right line the north side of East 37th Street. Forming a backdrop are skyscrapers, which from left to right (collective views) are, the Empire State, the 10 East 4Oth Strect, the New York Trust, the Lefcourt Colonial, the 5O( Fifth Avenue, the Lincoln, the Chanin
and the Cnrysler Buildings.
View 1: June 28, 1939
Views 2-3:  July 23, 1939
P.  . Sperr

712277f-a.text:
East 36th Street, west from First avenue, showing the cleared area extending 1 block souare and which will provide an extance to the new l.idtown - Gueens Tunnel. 712278f-a.text:
E. 36th Street, west from First Avenue, showing the clearance extending between 36th and 37th Streets. Thru this area will run the Midtown Queens Tunnel. Standing alone to the left is the St. Gabriel's branch of the New York Public Library. This soon will be demolished. In the right background are skyscrapers
forming the Fifth Avenue-42nd Street outline.
Sept. 20, 1939
Nathan Schwartz
New York Public Library

712279f-a.text:
E. 36th St., north side, west from 1st Avenue, showing a row of buildings extending to 2nd Avenue, that are to be completely razed (May 1939) for the 38th St. tunnel approach. To the
left is St. Gabriel's Park.
.January 8, 1939
Somach Photo Service
New York City Tunnel Authority

712280f-b.text:
East 36th Street, at the N.W. corner of First Avenue, showing construction for the plaza of the Midtown-Queens tunnel. The underground cut is enclosed by the second
fence.
Tenements seen are on the north side of 37th Street between First and Second Avenues. Across the background from let to right, are the Lincoln, Chanin, Chrysler and
News Buildings.
View 1: May 26, 1939
Views 2-3: June 28, 1939
P. L. Sperr

712280f-c.text:
East 36th Street, at the N.W. corner of First Avenue, showing construction for the plaza of the Midtown-Queens tunnel. The underground cut is enclosed by the second

712282f-a.text:
E. 36th Street, north side, west from (No. 325, right) a point midway between First and Second Avenue and to the latter (left). Shown are St. Gabriel's Parochial School, its Hall and the New York Public Library branch building. To the right are two tenements bearing No's 323 and 325. All of these face the upper end of St. Gabriel's Park and will be found missing in June 1939, having been demolished (exclusive of the Library building/ for
the approach to the 38th Street tunnel.
January 12, 1939
Somach Photo Service
New York City Tunnel Authority

712283f-b.text:
East 36th Street, north side, west from a point midway between First and Second avenues, and across the latter, to show St, Gabriels Parochial School under demolition. The Church of this name is to the rear, facing on the south side of East 37th Street, and is in the same condition. The three story Hall adjoins the School and will shortly follow. To the west is the New York Public Library branch building identified with this Church. This will remain standing until early 1940 when this will be razed also. View No. 3 is photographed from St. Gabriels Park and shows the shadowy outlines of the Chrysler and Lincoln Buildings across the School and Library respectively.
No. 1 May 25, 1939
2 May 26, 1939
L. Sperr  3 May 27, 1939

712283f-c.text:

2 May 26, 1939

712285f-b.text:
East 3oth Street (foreground), north side, between First and Second Avenues, showing a northerly view of the partially demolished St. Gabriel's Ron.an Catholic Church. This edifice faces on the south side of 37th Street, slightly east of Second Avenue. An entire block is being razed for the plaza approach to the Midtown-Queens tunnel under the East River.
Across the background are skyscrapers, which from left to right are, the Lincoln, Cnanin and Chrysler.
Buildings.
May 26, 1939
Views: 1-2-3
P. L. Sperr

712294f-c.text:
East 36th Street, south side, west from First to Second evenues, showing the northerly side of St. Gabriel's Park. Dominating the scene is the towering Empire State
Building at Fifth Avenue and 34th Street.
View 1: July 23, 1939
Views2-3 May 27, 1939
P. L. Sperr

707585f-b.text:
First Avenue, at the N. W. corner of East 36th Street, and westward to show the open area enclosing the entrance to the Midtown-Queens Tunnel. The buildings on the right face on the north side of East 37th Street. In the background is Second Avenue, with its elevated line thereupon. Skyscrapers of the 42nd Street-Grand
Central zone dominate the skyline.
September 21, 1940
No's. 1-2
P. L. Sperr

707585f-a.text:
First Avenue, at the N. W. corner of East 36th Street, and westward to show the open area enclosing the entrance to the Midtown-Queens Tunnel. The buildings on the right face on the north side of East 37th Street. In the background is Second Avenue, with its elevated line thereupon. Skyscrapers of the 42nd Street-Grand
Central zone dominate the skyline.
September 21, 1940
No's. 1-2
P. L. Sperr

707582f-c.text:
First Avenue, north from East 36th Street, showing mainly the west side of this thoroughfare. In the foreground is the cleared area for the plaza approach to the
Midtown-Queens tunnel.
Tnis property is the fenced zone extending from 36th to 37th Streets. The 37th -38th Street frontage is also being utilized. Beyond,appear the Eleto Warehouse and Tudor City Buildings. To the left is the utilitarian
News Building.
Viewl: May 26, 1939
View2: June 28, 1939
P. L. Sperr

707586f-a.text:
First Avenue, west side, from E. 36th (left) to 37th (right) Streets. The four tenements at the left will be razed in June, joining those that surrounded same. At the right margin appears a portion of the Eleto Go. warehouse which occupies the entire lower
end of the 38th -39th Street block.
January 7, 1939
Somach Photo Service
New York City Tunnel Authority

712284f-c.text:
East 3eth St: eet, north side, between First and Second Avenues, showing the cieared forner site of St. Gabriel's Church and Parocaial School. To the left and not shown is tne still standing New York Public Library brauch. The 'El" line in the midground is on Second Avenue. To the right are tenements on the north side of 37th Street, slightly east of tne Avenue. The N.E. corner there is cleared also, the samme has no connection with tne tunnel project. Centered in the uistwnce is the spred Chrysler Building, flanked by tne Gnanin and News structures.
View 1: June 28, 1939
Views 2-3: July 23, 1939
P. L. Sperr

plaza being cleared.
WOrkmen are occupied On the former site nf St.
Gabriel's Whurch and School.
A.cross same appear buildings at 37th Street i(left of center) and First avOnue (right of center). 712287f-c.text:
East 36th Street, north side, between First and Second avenues, showing workmen clearing the former
site of St. Gabriel's Church and school.
Note the corner stone of same in the foreground. To the left is the Second Avenue "El" and to the right, 37th Street tenements. View No. 3 shows the last mentioned
feature only.
June 28, 1939
Views: 1-2-3
P. L. SpeIr

712288f-b.text:
(1)
East 36th Street, north side, west from, and including First, to but not including Second Aves., as seen from across St. Gabriel's
Park.
Beptember 10, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, showing a view further westward, to and including Second Ave. The Second Ave., Elevated Line appears on the right. Prominent buildings shown from left to right, are St. Gabriel's Branch of the N. Y. Public Library, rear of St. Gabriel's Hall and Parochial School
of St. Gabriel.
September 20, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same, as seen across the Second Ave. Elevated tracks.
February 5, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.

712293f-a.text:
337-9-41 E. 36th Street, north side, west of First Avenue, showing three tenements that will be demolished (May 1939) for the construction of the approach of the 38th Street tunnel under the East River. These face the lower end of St. Gabriel's Park,
where the photographer is standing.
January 12, 1939
Somach Photo Service
New York City Tunnel Authority
